timeline.bodyText:
This isn't correct. The ValueComparator needs to fall back to its own way of ordering values if QueryEvaluationUtil throws an Exception. So we need to catch the exception, to make sure that the rest of the method gets executed if the QueryEvaluationUtil comparison fails.
The reason for the difference between ValueComparator and QueryEvaluationUtil is that ValueComparator is used for sorting/ordering query results, and that is never allowed to throw an error: if something is a result, we always need to find a way to order it. QueryEvaluationUtil, on the other hand, is also used for handling things likes FILTER conditions in SPARQL queries, and needs to be able to throw errors when certain comparisons aren't valid.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra
